meanings.definition: A person filled with excessive and single-minded zeal, especially for an extreme religious or political cause.
meanings.sent1: The fanatics protested outside the government building, demanding change.
meanings.sent2: The group of fanatics gathered every Sunday to discuss their beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The fanatics decided to have a bake sale to raise money for their cause.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for the environment turned her into a fanatic for recycling.
meanings.sent5: The fanatics' unwavering dedication inspired others to join their movement.

meanings.definition: A person with an obsessive interest in and enthusiasm for a particular activity or thing.
meanings.sent1: The movie fanatics lined up outside the theater for the midnight premiere.
meanings.sent2: She was a fanatic when it came to collecting vintage stamps.
meanings.sent3: The fanatics spent hours debating the best strategy for their favorite video game.
meanings.sent4: His love for cars made him a fanatic for attending car shows.
meanings.sent5: The fanatics' excitement was contagious, spreading to everyone around them.
